main event: Multiple silvery white objects flying at high altitude and very high speed were observed in Springer, New Mexico on April 25, 1949. The objects were seen flying in formation and displaying rapid and erratic movements over the course of an hour.
interesting points: Observers heard a noise resembling a group of ducks, which drew their attention to the objects passing overhead.
The objects were described as silvery white and appeared to be small, round balls, like Christmas tree ornaments.
The objects were observed to be moving faster than sound, ruling out the possibility of them being jet planes or guided missiles.
The formations of objects displayed unusual behavior, such as sudden changes in direction and splitting off from the main group.
The observers reported that visibility was unlimited, and the weather conditions were clear and conducive to sighting the objects.
sighted object: Multiple silvery white objects flying at high speeds in formation
